title: Randomly can't move -at all- in game
body:
For most of the last year I've had stable 19 ping. Now my ping will randomly spike to 20-33 (which still isn't too bad in the grand scheme of things), but during those moments, I can't issue -any- movement commands or spells for 3-4 seconds. My character will literally just stand there and then the movement commands will sometimes go through after that period is over, but by then I'm usually just dead. 

It's been happening every game for the past few days. I've made sure that there's no other traffic on my internet. Anyone else experiencing this problem or know of a fix? It is frustrating to randomly lose a 2v2 because you just can't do anything for 3-4 seconds.  I basically can't even queue until i know I've resolved the problem.

replies.body: That sounds an awful lot like packet loss, so let's run a quick traceroute to be sure of what's happening before moving too much further. Grab a tool like [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/winmtr-v0-92-now-available/) to run a trace to 104.160.131.1, then post those results here for me to look over. Might be able to pinpoint where the problem is coming from with that data!

Nah don't need to trace while playing, but it would be a good idea to check this trace or use the [**lag report tool**](https://lagreport.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/) to check your scores if you notice any problems in a game.

That trace actually looks pretty clean with a steady 78 ping with no packet loss. Since you ran the trace about 15~ hours after posting this, hopefully that means the packet loss had cleared up. Are you still seeing any moments where you can't move or do anything? Things might be okay now, but let if know if not so we can try a couple other things to smooth this out.

It's been happening a lot lately. I thought I fixed it back when I made this post, by disabling superfetch, which I found would randomly start using a lot of CPU when I was in-game. But now the problem is happening again every game, even after disabling anything I can think of in task manager.
